title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic science fiction adventure following the misadventures of Arthur Dent.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: The epic saga of the Foundation, a group of scientists who strive to shorten a dark age.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A science fiction epic set on a desert planet, exploring themes of politics, religion, and ecology.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: A young boy is recruited to train in combat to save Earth from an alien invasion.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars and must use his ingenuity to survive.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A science fiction novel that blends cyberpunk, virtual reality, and ancient Sumerian mythology.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel exploring societal pressures and romantic relationships in 19th-century England.

title: Emma
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty novel about a well-meaning but often misguided young woman who interferes in the romantic lives of her friends.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
description: The story of a young woman's journey of self-discovery and her passionate love for Mr. Rochester.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: A novel about the lives of four sisters growing up during the American Civil War.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A story about the enduring power of love, even in the face of adversity.

title: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A story about an unlikely bond formed between a young woman and a paralyzed man.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age story about a teenage boy's experiences with alienation and phoniness.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about wealth, love, and the American Dream in the Jazz Age.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A satirical novel about a boy's journey down the Mississippi River with a runaway slave.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A novel narrated by Death, about a young girl living in Nazi Germany who finds solace in stolen books.

title: The Secret History
author: Donna Tartt
description: A psychological thriller about a group of classics students who become involved in a murder.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy novel about a quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The beginning of the magical journey of Harry Potter.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The first book in the 'A Song of Ice and Fire' series, a complex tale of power struggles and betrayal.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The first book in 'The Kingkiller Chronicle,' about the legendary figure Kvothe.

title: Jonathan Strange & Mr Norrell
author: Susanna Clarke
description: A historical fantasy novel set in 19th-century England, where magic is reintroduced.

title: The Priory of the Orange Tree
author: Samantha Shannon
description: An epic fantasy standalone novel about a world of queens, dragons, and a divided world.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that controls every aspect of human life.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where women are oppressed.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A classic dystopian novel set in a technologically advanced future society.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel where books are banned and firemen burn any that are found.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son struggle to survive in a post-apocalyptic world.

title: A Clockwork Orange
author: Anthony Burgess
description: A dystopian satire about a young man's experiences with violence and rehabilitation.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about the journey of Odysseus back to his home after the Trojan War.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that tells the story of the Trojan War.

title: Beowulf
author: Unknown
description: An Old English epic poem about a hero who battles monsters.

title: The Epic of Gilgamesh
author: Unknown
description: One of the earliest known works of literature, from ancient Mesopotamia.

title: The Aeneid
author: Virgil
description: A Latin epic poem that tells the story of Aeneas, a Trojan who traveled to Italy and became the ancestor of the Romans.

title: Paradise Lost
author: John Milton
description: An epic poem by John Milton, published in 1667, tells the Biblical story of the Fall of Man.
